title: Curvature-induced moduli stabilization
abstract:
We discuss FLRW-cosmologies with negatively-curved spatial slices that induce
a late-time stabilization of all the moduli of an effective field theory
through Hubble friction, independently of the moduli-space curvature. This
holds for pure moduli, which appear ubiquitously in string compactifications.
Crucially, the cosmological solutions approach a Milne universe. Hence, the
mechanism we describe in fact corresponds to late-time moduli stabilization in
Minkowski spacetime.
